result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Laura Michelle Sain

defendant.name: Sain, Laura Michelle
defendant.address: 751 County Road K, Taycheedah Correctional Institution, Fond du Lac, WI 54936-1947

records.addlTxt:
3:52 PM Defendant Laura Michelle Sain appeared by video, in custody from Taycheedah.  Attorney Mark J Gumz appeared by video for Laura Michelle Sain.  Attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Gumz states that he and the Defendant received a copy of the information & waives it's reading. Defendant stands mute.  Attorney request the Court enter a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant. 
Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands. 

BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant. 
Set status
bond continued
Status hearing scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status hearing on December 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

11:31 AM Defendant Laura Michelle Sain appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Mark J Gumz appeared by video for Laura Michelle Sain.  Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Gumz states that the defendant will be waiving the Prelim today and has discussed the waiver with his client.  Court questions the defendant regarding in-person appearance.  Defendant waives their in-person appearance today & will proceed by zoom. 

Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Atty Burdon files the information electronically with the Court.  Atty Gumz received a copy of the information and waives its reading. 

BY THE COURT:  Set Arraignment
Atty Gumz to contact the JA to set up
Arraignment scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

2:13 PM Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Laura Michelle Sain appeared by video.  Attorney Mark J Gumz appeared by video for Laura Michelle Sain. 
Atty Gumz states that the defendant will be in custody until February next year at least.  Atty Gumz asks for a Prelim to be set.

BY THE COURT:  Set Preliminary Hearing by zoom per request
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 27, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Status hearing on August 15, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Laura Michelle Sain
Current: 751 County Road K, Taycheedah Correctional Institution, Fond du Lac, WI 54936-1947 United States  (Effective: 06-07-2022)
Prior: 3570 Patti Drive #4, Plover, WI 54467

1:58 PM Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Laura Michelle Sain not in court, in custody.  Attorney Mark J Gumz appeared by video for Laura Michelle Sain. 
off the record, Atty Gumz noted that the defendant is in Taycheedah not in Waupaca County Jail anymore. Atty Gumz has an offer; requests a reset so he can review that with his client.

BY THE COURT:  Set status
Status hearing scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status hearing on June 20, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status hearing on May 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

10:09 AM Defendant Laura Michelle Sain appeared by video means from Waupaca County Jail with Attorney Mark J Gumz. . Attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Gumz states that he and the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.    Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands.  
Atty Gumz waives time limits for the Prelim; requests a status.  Defendant is not sure if she agrees to that.  Atty Gumz asks for a breakout room.  
BREAKOUT ROOM

BACK ON THE RECORD:
10:21am  Atty Gumz states that in speaking with his client; the defendant is going to waive the time limits.  Defendant agrees.

BY THE COURT:   Defendant waives time limits for the preliminary hearing.
bond continued  Status hearing scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Initial appearance on April 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Initial appearance on April 4, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Initial appearance on February 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.
*No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription

03:32 PM Defendant Laura Michelle Sain appeared by video means (in custody). Prosecuting Atty Brian J. Juech appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.  Court advises defendant of the maximum penalties.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands.  Defendant would like to contact an attorney.  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable casue for Riverside purposes.
Atty Juech requests $500 cash bond with conditions.  Defendant states she can only pay about $250.00 and is currenlty on a PO hold.  BY THE COURT:  Court orders cash bond of $250.00 with conditions.  Initial appearance scheduled for February 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.
